00046 #ifndef AMP_amp_raw_mutex_H
00047 #define AMP_amp_raw_mutex_H
00048 
00049 #include <amp/amp_mutex.h>
00050 
00051 
00052 
00053 #if defined(AMP_USE_PTHREADS)
00054 #   include <pthread.h>
00055 #elif defined(AMP_USE_WINTHREADS)
00056 #   define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN /* Only include streamlined windows header. */
00057 #   include <windows.h>
00058 #   if !defined(_WIN32_WINNT) || (_WIN32_WINNT < 0x0403) /* To support CRITICAL_SECTION */
00059 #       error Windows version not supported.
00060 #   endif
00061 #else
00062 #   error Unsupported platform.
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 
00066 
00067 
00068 #if defined(__cplusplus)
00069 extern "C" {
00070 #endif
00071 
00082     struct amp_raw_mutex_s {
00083 #if defined(AMP_USE_PTHREADS)
00084         /* Don't copy or move - therefore don't copy or move amp_mutex_s. */
00085         pthread_mutex_t mutex;
00086 #elif defined(AMP_USE_WINTHREADS)
00087         /* Don't copy or move - therefore don't copy or move amp_mutex_s. */
00088         CRITICAL_SECTION critical_section;
00089         /* Helper to prevent recursive locking on Windows. This is always
00090          * included instead of only in debug mode because the interface and the
00091          * way the source is compiled can differ which might lead to hard to 
00092          * track down errors.
00093          */
00094         BOOL is_locked;
00095 #else
00096 #   error Unsupported platform.
00097 #endif
00098     };
00099     
00100 
00101     
00106     int amp_raw_mutex_init(amp_mutex_t mutex);
00107     
00112     int amp_raw_mutex_finalize(amp_mutex_t mutex);
00113     
00114

00116 #if defined(__cplusplus)
00117 } /* extern "C" */
